thread.title: Robbie Williams pays tribute to his dead dog Spencer with 'My Way' video - Music
thread.title_full: Robbie Williams pays tribute to his dead dog Spencer with 'My Way' video - Music News - Digital Spy

author: Lewis Corner
title: Robbie Williams pays tribute to his dead dog Spencer with 'My Way' video - Music
text: Robbie Williams has paid tribute to the passing of his pet dog Spencer with a stirring video montage.The British singer used a live recording of his cover of Frank Sinatra's 'My Way' to soundtrack home footage of the pooch's life and times."Sad news guys, today we lost Spencer. Heartbroken and shocked. We love and miss you so much Spencer," Robbie tweeted before posting the video on his official YouTube channel.Sad news guys, today we lost Spencer. Heartbroken and shocked. We love and miss you so much Spencer x pic.twitter.com/5JOOECbdJLâ€” Robbie Williams (@robbiewilliams) September 29, 2015Robbie has been touring the world during the summer months, playing a number of headline festival dates across Europe.It follows the release of his two albums, Take the Crown in 2012 and Swings Both Ways in 2013. Robbie surprised fans with a brand new album called Under the Radar Vol 1 last December, but only sold it through his official website, meaning it was chart ineligible.Meanwhile, Robbie will be celebrating the first birthday of his second child Charlton Valentine later this month, while his first daughter Theodora Rose turned 3 in September.
